etymologies: Middle English: from Old French (peau) martrine ‘marten (fur)’, from martre, of West Germanic origin

definitions: a chiefly arboreal weasel-like mammal found in Eurasia and North America, hunted for its fur in many northern countries.

notes.text: Genus Martes, family Mustelidae: several species. See pine marten, stone marten

shortDefinitions: semi-arboreal weasel-like mammal found in Eurasia and North America
